Its patented API Protection Platform is the only API security solution that combines the power of cloud-scale big data and time-tested ML/AI to detect and prevent API attacks. By correlating activities across millions of APIs and users over time, Salt delivers deep context with real-time analysis and continuous insights for API discovery, attack prevention, and shift-left practices. Deployed in minutes and seamlessly integrated within existing systems, the Salt Security platform gives customers immediate value and protection, so they can innovate with confidence and accelerate their digital transformation initiatives.

name: Deno
description: Deno is building application development for the modern web.

name: Popsink
description: Popsink helps teams build and deploy data products whose impact generalizes well beyond dashboards. It provides a simple interface for users to easily capture, process and share data with humans and systems alike – all in real-time.

name: Airtime
description: Airtime (FKA mmhmm) is a new and better way to create clear, compelling video communications. With Airtime, companies and individuals can define their style and coordinate how they show up on camera so that everyone can work better together.

name: Nuvo
description: Nuvo is building the infrastructure to transform how businesses connect, trade and grow. It provides businesses with instant access to critical trust signals that allow them to start working with new customers quickly and confidently.

name: Ironclad
description: Ironclad is a contract lifecycle management platform that enables collaboration and negotiation while maintaining compliance. It’s the only platform flexible enough to handle every type of contract workflow, be it a sales agreement, HR agreement or a complex non-disclosure agreement.

name: [24]7.ai
description: [24]7.aiuses AI technology to help businesses attract and retain customers with a personalized, predictive and effortless experience.[24]7.aigives companies the ability to know and act on consumer intent in milliseconds.

name: Alpha & Omega Semiconductor
description: Alpha & Omega Semiconductor is a designer, developer and global supplier of a broad range of power semiconductors.

name: FastAPI Labs
description: FastAPI Labs helps developers build apps and APIs with open source and cloud-based tools.

name: Reflect Orbital
description: Reflect Orbital sells sunlight from orbit to solar farms and large-scale lighting applications after sunset using a very large constellation of in-space reflectors. More hours of sunlight translates into higher solar energy production for existing solar farms and other economic benefits.

name: Neuralink
description: Neuralink is building a brain-computer interface to restore autonomy to those with unmet medical needs today and unlock human potential tomorrow.

name: Strava
description: Strava is the world’s social network for athletes, tracking cycling, running and more for smarter training, constant improvement and endless exploring. With billions of activity uploads worldwide, Strava is building a record of the world’s athletic activities.

name: Mellanox
description: Mellanox (acquired by Nvidia) provided high-speed networking hardware including InfiniBand and Ethernet adapters for data centers. It specialized in low-latency interconnect solutions essential for AI and high-performance computing workloads.

name: Aspora
description: Aspora is building full stack banking for diaspora populations starting with the Indian diaspora. They enable non-resident Indians to move money seamlessly across borders at the lowest costs.

name: Skyramp
description: Skyramp is an AI-driven testing platform that acts like a personal QA engineer for your dev team. It automatically generates functional and performance tests in seconds, covering everything from API endpoints to full user flows, allowing teams to ship with confidence on every release.

name: Blues
description: Blues helps physical product makers transform their offerings into data-driven intelligent services. Blues solves the biggest challenges associated with IoT connectivity, making it easy to securely cloud-connect any physical product.

name: Warp
description: Warp is the first Agentic Development Environment, built for coding with multiple agents.

name: Formation Bio
description: Formation Bio is a tech and AI-native pharma company differentiated by radically more efficient drug development.

name: Bridge
description: Bridge, now a part of Stripe, is building critical infrastructure to support stablecoin payments enabling companies to move money at internet speed.

name: Privy
description: Privy (acquired by Stripe) builds privacy tooling for Web3. With Privy, developers can manage users’ private data off-chain. Privy makes user data simple. With a few lines of code, developers integrate sensitive user data into your product securely. They can build more delightful experiences into their product. Their users stay in control of their data.

name: Reflection AI
description: Reflection AI is building superintelligent autonomous systems, starting with coding agents.

name: Cresta
description: Cresta helps businesses save money, increase revenue and build customer loyalty with the only unified platform for human and AI agents built for enterprise scale.

name: Magentic
description: Magentic is building the AI Agent Platform for the world’s supply chains. It helps global manufacturers and infrastructure operators hunt down and deliver cost savings opportunities with AI teammates called “Mages.”

name: Gigi
description: Gigi is the AI social network redefining how people connect, signal status and unlock opportunity. Gigi makes context king—who you know, who trusts you, what you’ve built and how others perceive you—to reveal your social capital.

name: Anterior
description: Anterior is alleviating the $950B administrative burden in the U.S. healthcare industry by supercharging health plans with AI co:pilots for complex and manual workflows.

name: Telda
description: Telda is a payment and money transfer platform for millennials and Gen Z. For those who’ve sought an alternative to traditional banking, Telda offers a better way to send, spend and save money.

name: Two
description: Two is a pure-B2B online payment method. It was founded to make bcommerce purchases as frictionless for business buyers as ecommerce is for retail.

name: Zefir
description: Zefir stands against the prevalent ‘every man for himself’ mentality in real estate. They have created the first collective sales platform that not only accelerates the connection between sellers and buyers but also fosters cooperation among all real estate agents. By dividing roles among various agents, ensuring fair compensation, evaluating performance, and centralizing a network of buyers and properties, they are setting a new standard for efficiency and transparency in the industry.

name: Turnkey
description: Turnkey allows developers to generate and manage private keys across blockchains. With a simple API, builders can spin-up thousands of wallets, sign millions of transactions, and set permissions to ensure only allowed transactions are signed. Turnkey was built on a minimal, immutable, and deterministic operating system, designed for environments requiring paranoia and accountability putting builders in control of their keys while providing institutional-grade security.

name: Squint
description: Squint is a platform that connects the digital and physical worlds using cameras, sensors, and user data to present contextual information at the right time and place. With Squint, users can interact with the world around them through powerful and contextually-aware AR experiences.

name: Elevate
description: Elevate is a new type of cognitive-training tool designed to build communication and analytical skills. Users receive a personalized gamified program that evolves with their performance, encouraging them to keep learning.

name: Rillet
description: Rillet is the AI-native ERP made to tailor fit the workflows of accountants and a full replacement for legacy ERPs. Fast-growing companies use Rillet to enable a smarter close with native integrations, automated journal entries and AI embedded workflows supporting multi-entity, multi-currency and multi-geography.
why_partnered: We partnered with Rillet because Nicolas and Stelios experienced the pain of legacy general ledger solutions firsthand while scaling N26, recognizing that AI’s massive savings potential was pushing CFOs to innovate. They decided to rebuild an AI-native ERP from the ground up with a mission to enable zero-day closes and a “one-person Finance function.” This addresses companies forced to graduate from limited products to arcane systems requiring 10+ specialists and 15-20 days of manual work monthly. What impressed us most was their vision for agentic automation of the Finance function, which we believe will take the CFO experience to a whole new level.

name: Kalshi
description: Kalshi is the first federally regulated exchange dedicated to trading on future events. Its exchange allows investors to buy yes or no positions on possible events through a novel asset class called event contracts.

name: Zed
description: Zed is a next-generation open-source, multiplayer code editor designed for high-performance collaboration with humans and AI. Founded by the creators of Atom and Electron, Zed is designed to make software creation joyful, fast and collaborative.

name: Klarna
description: Klarna eases the pain of the checkout process by separating purchase from payment. With Klarna, users proceed to checkout while Klarna foots the bill and invoices later.

name: Irregular
description: Irregular is a frontier security lab protecting increasingly capable and sophisticated AI systems. It builds next-generation defenses through high-fidelity research platforms that simulate and monitor real-world AI security scenarios.

name: Nominal
description: Nominal builds the essential software stack that enables hardware teams to test and iterate as rapidly as software teams. With deep roots in aerospace and defense, Nominal empowers engineers to continuously monitor, validate and deploy innovations, transforming how mission-critical hardware is built and operated.

name: ElevenLabs
description: ElevenLabs is a Voice AI research and deployment company making content universally accessible in any language and voice. They use natural speech synthesis to enable users to create and design AI voices across a vast swathe of languages, accents, emotions, and delivery styles. The company’s in-house research drives the development of its technology, which includes tools for audiobook publishing, voiceovers, AI dubbing, and applications in entertainment, education, accessibility, and personal use.

name: LangChain
description: LangChain is an LLM programming framework for AI applications. Its open-source toolkit allows the growing community of developers to build sophisticated, data-aware applications on top of LLMs.

name: Fireworks AI
description: Fireworks AI is a high-performance inference platform for developers and enterprises to run open-source LLMs and image models or to fine-tune and deploy their own.

name: Sierra
description: Sierra is a conversational AI platform for businesses. It helps companies elevate customer experience through AI agents that they can personalize to act as extensions of their brand.

name: Magic
description: Magic is training frontier models to build an AI software engineer that feels like a co-worker. Its goal is to automate AI research and code generation to solve safe AGI.

name: Snowflake
description: Snowflake powers the data cloud. It is a solution for all things data: warehousing, lakes, engineering, science, application development and sharing. It allows organizations to unite their siloed data, easily discover and securely share governed data, and execute diverse analytic workloads.
why_partnered: Snowflake was creating the data warehouse of the future: one built for the cloud and optimized for cloud workloads. The company’s vision, paired with the technical excellence of the team and user-centric design made it clear that they were going to become a category-defining business with the power to endure.

name: Google
description: Google founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin wanted to organize the world’s information. The result is Google Search, the world’s most popular way to find information online. Google’s products include email, maps, news, shopping, payment processing and more. Google continues to invest in an open web and new technologies that improve our way of life.
why_partnered: Larry and Sergey were on a mission to organize the world’s information, and make it universally accessible and useful. It was clear to us that they had built a superior search engine with Google. Creative partnerships where Google powered search for the Washington Post and Netscape confirmed their product’s strength and signaled a future where Google would become a verb synonymous with satisfying curiosity.

name: Ramp
description: Ramp provides spend management, corporate cards and accounts payable solutions to help businesses optimize finance operations in a single platform.

name: Palo Alto Networks
description: Palo Alto Networks is a global cybersecurity leader. It’s shaping the cloud-centric future with technology that transforms the way people and organizations operate. Its software helps address the world’s greatest security challenges using the latest breakthroughs in AI, analytics, automation and orchestration.

name: OpenEvidence
description: OpenEvidence is an AI copilot for doctors that helps them make high stakes decisions at the point of care. Its mission is to organize and expand the world’s collective medical knowledge. Aside from the iPhone, there has never been a piece of technology adopted by doctors as quickly as OpenEvidence.

name: NVIDIA
description: NVIDIA pioneered the art and science of visual computing. Its invention of the GPU transformed the PC from a tool for productivity into one for creativity and discovery. Enhanced visual graphics benefit everyone, from gamers and scientists to consumers and enterprise customers. NVIDIA is changing the way people work and play with modern technology.

name: Harvey
description: Harvey is a generative AI company backed by Sequoia and OpenAI. They partner with elite law firms and professional service providers to augment their expertise with cutting edge AI to tackle the world’s most complex business challenges.

name: Day.ai
description: Day.ai is an AI-native CRM that brings the voice of the customer into every decision. Its product combines a meeting assistant, CRM and knowledge base into a single unified solution.

name: Paid
description: Paid is an all-in-one, drop-in Revenue Engine for AI Agents that handles pricing, subscriptions, margins, billing, and renewals with just a few lines of code.

name: Gong
description: Gong helps revenue teams realize their full potential by sharing customer insights. Gong’s platform captures customer interactions and delivers insights at scale so revenue teams feel empowered to make decisions with data. With Gong, customers see improved win rates, larger deals and faster employee ramp-up times.

name: Traversal
description: Traversal is an AI SRE agent that troubleshoots, resolves and prevents production incidents—so engineers can ship features, not fixes.

name: n8n
description: n8n is a free open node-based workflow automation tool. It can be self-hosted, easily extended and used with third-party web applications or custom in-house tools to automate repetitive tasks. With n8n, people can build multistep workflows using third-party APIs and their own internal tools.

name: Hugging Face
description: Hugging Face is a community-based repository for open-source ML technology. It is a platform that stores, serves, and manages the latest and greatest in open-source ML models, including enabling customers to fine-tune these models and deploy them at scale. Hugging Face’s secret sauce is its community: it has become a go-to destination for companies and researchers in the world of ML to collaborate. In this respect, it can be loosely analogized to GitHub, but for ML rather than traditional software engineering.

name: Listen Labs

name: Zapier
description: Zapier is an online automation tool that connects apps and services. It makes it easy to move and synch data between apps without relying on developers to code the integration.

name: Tilt

name: Juicebox
description: Juicebox is the AI recruiting platform that analyzes millions of profiles using natural language. It ranks candidates against pre-set criteria, recommends the best matches and handles outreach and coordination. With Juicebox, teams win better candidates, faster.

name: Trade Republic
description: Trade Republic is a technology company with a German banking license that makes capital markets accessible and affordable for everyone. The company does this by making investing in stocks, ETFs, derivatives and cryptocurrencies easy, secure and free.

name: Avelios

name: Ledgy
description: Ledgy is transforming the culture of ownership in Europe and beyond. Equity can be a powerful catalyst for growth, helping companies raise funds and reward talent. But as companies grow, managing equity gets harder, not easier. Ledgy’s platform gives companies, employees and investors unparalleled insight into their ownership.

name: Profound
description: Profound is an AI visibility and content creation platform that helps brands monitor and optimize how they appear in AI-powered search results. As consumers increasingly turn to AI assistants for product research, Profound gives marketers the tools to control their presence in AI systems. Profound empowers businesses to win in a future where AI agents, not blue links, drive discovery.

name: Upway
description: Upway is the first marketplace devoted to the second-hand purchase, reconditioning and resale of electric bikes under warranty. Upway’s team of professional repair staff ensure the quality of each bike, and it prices the bikes significantly lower than a new product.

name: Delphi
description: Delphi lets experts scale their time and knowledge through interactive digital minds. Its AI-powered avatars mirror users’ speaking and thinking patterns from their existing content, enabling anyone to provide valuable advice globally through voice, text and video.

name: Flow Engineering

Companies like Rivian, Joby, Astrianis and Radiant Nuclear are built on Flow.

name: Knowde
description: Knowde is the marketplace for chemicals, polymers and ingredients. For the first time, users can search, filter, sample and quote from every major producer, all on one site.

name: Abby Care
description: Abby Care trains family members to become paid caregivers for loved ones with disabilities or special needs. It provides training and community support to deliver better care at lower cost.

name: Crosby

Crosby combines the speed and intelligence of AI with the safety of lawyers-in-the-loop to review contracts in minutes. Crosby negotiates MSAs, DPAs and NDAs for fast-growing businesses, using speed and intelligence to reach agreement faster, and unblock sales teams.

name: Grow Therapy
description: Grow Therapy is an online therapy platform making insurance-covered therapy easier to deliver and easier to find—enabling 1M+ clients through partnerships with 100+ insurance plans.

name: Mithril
description: Mithril is orchestrating the world’s compute capacity, making it universally accessible for AI workloads. Its GPU cloud services deliver performance, reliability and flexibility for managing training runs, serving applications or accelerating research.

name: CUE Labs
description: CUE Labs, the company behind the CUE open-source project, builds a Configuration Control Plane that turns configuration from a source of risk into a source of reliability. It enables teams and organizations to understand, audit and validate all data, from build-time configurations to runtime payloads, to prevent outages and ensure compliance.

name: Tavus
description: Tavus is a research lab pioneering human computing. Their real-time human simulation models let machines see, hear, respond, and even look real, enabling meaningful face-to-face conversations with people. Imagine a therapist that anyone can afford; a personal trainer that adapts to your schedule; medical assistants that can give every patient the attention they need, available 24/7, in every language.

name: Sunflower Labs
description: Sunflower Labs developed the world’s first fully autonomous, AI-powered drone security system. Its Beehive platform—combining a self-charging drone, smart base station and cloud intelligence—delivers scalable, real-time protection for commercial, industrial and residential properties. Sunflower is deployed globally with partners including Alarm.com, Alert360, Securion, 10 Federal Companies, Swiss Federal Railways and many more.

name: Chainguard
description: Chainguard is the safe source for open source. The company’s mission is to make the software supply chain secure by default. Chainguard develops enterprise solutions to mitigate attacks along every stage of the software development cycle without sacrificing developer productivity.

name: Instacart
description: Instacart is building the best way for people around the world to shop for groceries and get them delivered instantly. With its vast network of pre-existing grocers and drivers, Instacart offers tremendous inventory and convenience to customers. Its on-demand service is available in most major U.S. metropolitan areas.

name: MongoDB
description: MongoDB is the leading general-purpose database platform designed to unleash the power of software and data for developers and their applications.

name: Neros
description: Neros develops and manufactures advanced unmanned drone systems for battlefield defense with a U.S. supply chain.

name: Garner Health
description: Garner Health helps employers enrich employee benefits and reduce costs without changing plans or networks. Its proprietary claims database identifies the doctors with the most accurate diagnoses and the best patient outcomes and makes it easy to find convenient, in-network providers.

name: Replicate
description: Replicate makes machine learning as easy to use as any other type of software. It has a library of hundreds of open-source models that you can run with a few lines of code. And if you’re building your own machine learning models, Replicate makes it easy to deploy them at scale.

name: Whatnot
description: Whatnot is the largest live shopping platform in North America, the U.K. and Europe. It brings people together through live, interactive shows where anyone can buy, sell, and connect over the things they love. From fashion and luxury to collectibles and cards, Whatnot helps sellers build thriving businesses and buyers engage deeply with passionate communities.

name: Rift
description: Rift is a focused platform for sales teams that consolidates outbound sales tooling and data in one place. It automates operational work so reps can focus on selling.

name: Ricursive Intelligence
description: Ricursive builds the AI stack that designs, verifies and closes silicon, so models and chips co-evolve in a tight loop. It enables a paradigm shift from fabless to “designless”: clients select the tradeoffs that matter to them, and Ricursive delivers a fully optimized, ready-to-build chip design. Models design next-gen chips that enable next-gen models, recursively accelerating our path to artificial superintelligence.

name: Fin
description: Fin is a next-generation payments platform built for high-value, global, and instant transactions. Powered by stablecoins, Fin enables users and businesses to move millions of dollars instantly—whether to other Fin users, directly into bank accounts, or across crypto rails. By combining the speed of crypto with the reliability of traditional finance, Fin reimagines how money moves worldwide. If banks and payment products could be rebuilt from the ground up today, they would look like Fin.

name: fal
description: fal is redefining the generative-media infrastructure layer for the AI era. As the leading platform for real-time video, image, audio and 3D generation, fal is building the world’s first Generative Media Cloud—designed to give developers and enterprises access to more than 600 production-ready models through a unified API. fal’s systems already support hundreds of millions of end users globally, a clear demonstration of the platform’s ability to operate at extraordinary scale.

name: Dust
description: Dust is an AI operating system for smart teams. It reshapes information management in the workplace by combining multiple large language models to process information, making it readily available when needed and in the format that makes sense. Dust can augment humans, enhance productivity, foster diversity and facilitate a more dynamic, personalized work experience.

name: Agency
description: Agency is an AI agent for customer success teams.

name: Tacto
description: Tacto is the AI-based operating system for future-proof supply chains in mid-sized industrials. As the central hub connecting these organizations with their supplier base, Tacto streamlines all procurement workflows, effortlessly ensures compliant and sustainable supply chains, and enables efficient material sourcing. With its solution, Tacto empowers mid-cap industrial organizations to future-proof their supply chains by intelligently procuring materials under optimal conditions with minimal effort.

name: Evy
description: Evy provides a turnkey product protection solution that can be fully integrated into a merchant’s existing sales channels. Customers benefit from a first-class service that gives them peace of mind from the moment of purchase. Evy is committed to facilitating product repairs over their replacement, by developing additional services such as buyback, recycling or reconditioning.

name: Unity
description: Unity is the world’s leading platform for creating and operating interactive, real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Unity’s products equip content creators with the tools to entertain and create innovative RT3D experiences across most industries.
why_partnered: In 2009 the demand for interactive technologies was growing exponentially across every category, from gaming and online virtual worlds to social networking platforms. We partnered with David because Unity was pioneering breakthrough products that allowed developers to respond to this new demand. We believed Unity could become the standard for high-quality digital content development.

name: Serval
description: Serval deploys AI agents for IT. Companies such as Perplexity, Mercor, Vercel, Verkada and Clay use Serval to automate help desk tickets, just-in-time access requests, onboarding and  offboarding flows, and more. With Serval, IT teams turn natural language prompts into complex automations in seconds, automating more than 50% of tickets on day one.

name: Mos
description: Mos is an app that gives college students access to the largest pool of financial aid and scholarships in America.

name: Nevis
description: Nevis is an AI platform built for wealth management that automates the core operational work of advisory firms. It removes manual processes across meetings, tasks, account opening and day-to-day operations, allowing advisors to spend more time with clients and less time on administration. By acting as a system that not only supports work but completes it, Nevis is reshaping how wealth management firms scale, grow and deliver personalized advice.

name: WithCoverage
description: WithCoverage replaces traditional insurance brokers with a new category of risk management. The company combines elite risk advisors with proprietary technology to give businesses full visibility into policies, exposures, compliance and claims. Its AI agents automate workflows, improve decision making, and deliver a materially higher standard of service and cost savings.

name: Sandstone
description: Sandstone enables modern in-house teams to move at the speed of AI, deliver better outcomes and create measurable business value. It unifies legal data, drives end-to-end workflows and organizes business context within the tools you already use. Sandstone is the home for AI-native legal departments.

name: Figma
description: Figma is the first web-based collaborative design tool. Multiple people can jump in a file at the same time, so they can design, prototype, copy code and gather feedback in one place. Figma has simplified the design process for teams of designers, developers, product managers, marketers and others at thousands of companies including Uber, Square, Twitter and GitHub.

name: Inferact
description: Inferact was founded by the creators and core maintainers of vLLM, the de facto standard open-source inference engine. The company builds inference systems at the intersection of model innovation and hardware diversity—supporting 200+ model architectures across major accelerator platforms with day-zero compatibility. Inferact is committed to advancing open-source infrastructure that makes AI inference fast, efficient and accessible.

name: Pace
description: Pace is the AI operations partner for the world’s leading insurers. They combine AI agents with deep industry expertise to automate mission critical back-office operations.

name: Blockit AI
description: Blockit is the first AI scheduling agent that actually understands time. The calendar is the last untouched social network—and AI finally unlocks it. When two Blockit users meet in the wild, the agent sees both calendars and instantly finds the best time. No back-and-forth. Scheduling accelerates from days to minutes. Come for the agent, stay for the network.

name: Anrok
description: Anrok is an end-to-end compliance solution for finance leaders of SaaS businesses. With a Supreme Court ruling increasing the paperwork required for software companies, Anrok allows them to track state nexus thresholds, taxability rules and tax rates, all in real time.

name: Ethos
description: Ethos makes it easier, faster and better for everyone to get life insurance. Ethos leverages deep technology and data science to make the process more convenient. It has issued billions in coverage each month while eliminating traditional barriers.

name: Mindy
description: Mindy is an AI-powered creator/brand platform built to fix the broken engine of influencer marketing. It gives everyday creators simple tools to make world-class content (and get rewarded) and helps brands scale authentic storytelling fast, turning nano and micro-creators into a high-performance creative workforce that produces thousands of unique, on-brand videos in days, not months.

name: Waymo
description: Waymo is on a mission to be the world’s most trusted driver. Making it safer, more accessible, and more sustainable to get around — without the need for anyone in the driver’s seat.

name: Rogo
description: Rogo is the generative AI platform for finance. With a suite of agents purpose-built for Wall Street, it’s trained to understand how bankers and investors actually work: from sourcing, diligence and modeling, to turning analysis into deliverables. Rogo is used by many of the world’s leading financial institutions and has been backed by Sequoia since 2025.

name: OpenAI
description: OpenAI is an AI research and deployment company dedicated to ensuring that general-purpose artificial intelligence benefits all of humanity.  It is dedicated to putting safety and human needs ahead of profit, and believes artificial intelligence has the potential to help people solve immense global challenges.

name: Sesame AI
description: Sesame is an interdisciplinary product and research team focused on creating lifelike voice agents that bring computers to life through natural human speech and interaction. The company develops systems designed to understand context, nuance and intent, enabling machines to see, hear and collaborate conversationally with people while advancing voice technology to cross the uncanny valley and make dialogue feel genuinely human-like. Their work spans intelligent voice agents that stay informed, provide conversational support and help users stay organized, alongside lightweight everyday wearable hardware that delivers seamless, high-quality access to voice agents in daily life.
